name: 04-Payer-Payment-Rate-Analysis-Model-RF
parameters: --var arg_gender='M','F' --var arg_payerPaymentRateClass='0-25','25-75','75-100' --var arg_Selectethnicity='hispanic','nonhispanic' --var arg_selectCategory='exam','laboratory','vitalsigns','procedure','socialhistory','survey' --var exploreData=false --var workflow_10_featurecolumns=ETHNICITY,GENDER,MARITAL,HEALTHCARE_EXPENSES,HEALTHCARE_COVERAGE,INCOME,TOTAL_CLAIM_COST,PAYER_COVERAGE --var workflow_12_inputcolumns1=ETHNICITY_INDEX,GENDER_INDEX,MARITAL_INDEX,HEALTHCARE_EXPENSES,HEALTHCARE_COVERAGE,INCOME,TOTAL_CLAIM_COST,PAYER_COVERAGE --var run1=true --var arg_gender1='%' --var arg_selectCategory1='exam','laboratory','vitalsigns','procedure','socialhistory','survey' --var selectModel=randomForestClassifier --var model=m1

nodes.name: Read CSV
nodes.description: It reads in CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it.
nodes.hint: Refresh the schema when a new file is selected or the file content has changed

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path of the file/directory

fields.name: separator
fields.title: Separator
fields.description: CSV Separator

fields.name: header
fields.title: Header
fields.description: Whether the file has a header row

fields.name: dropSpecialCharacterInColumnName
fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.name: mode
fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.name: addInputFileName
fields.title: Whether to Add Input File Name as Column in the Dataframe
fields.description: Add the new field:input_file_name

fields.name: encoding
fields.title: Encoding
fields.description: Decodes the CSV files by the given encoding type

fields.name: quote
fields.title: Quote
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.name: escape
fields.title: Escape
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value.

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Column Names for the CSV
fields.description: New Output Columns of the SQL

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Column Types for the CSV
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Column Formats for the CSV
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

fields.name: extraOptionsKeys
fields.title: Extra Options Keys
fields.description:
Extra options available when reading CSV files. Examples :
 comment --> # (ignore comment lines in the file)
ignoreLeadingWhiteSpace --> false (Ignores leading white spaces in string columns)
ignoreTrailingWhiteSpace --> false (Ignores trailing white spaces in string columns).
filterPushdown --> true (Enables filter pushdown to optimize query performance.)
samplingRatio --> 1.0 (Specifies the ratio of rows to sample when inferring schema.)
ignoreCorruptFiles --> false (Skips files with corrupt data instead of failing.)
ignoreMissingFiles --> false (Skips missing files instead of failing.)
pathGlobFilter --> *.csv (Filters file paths based on a specified glob pattern.)
recursiveFileLookup --> false (Enables recursive file lookup in directories.)

fields.name: extraOptionsValues
fields.title: Extra Options Values
fields.description: Config Values for the Corresponding keys

nodes.name: Split
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data. For example, if the fraction is .7, it would split the data into 2 DataFrames, one containing 70% of the rows(passed from lower edge id to next node) and the other containing the remaining 30%(passed from higher edge id to next node).

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: fraction1
fields.title: Fraction 1
fields.description: Fraction to be used for Splitting the DataFrame into two. The first DataFrame would go to the lower edge output. The other would go to the higher edge output.

nodes.description: Saves the DataFrame into the specified location in CSV Format

fields.name: header

fields.description: Should a Header Row be saved with each File?

fields.title: New Data Type
fields.description: New data type for the selected columns (INTEGER, DOUBLE, STRING, LONG, SHORT)

fields.name: replaceExistingCols
fields.title: Replace Existing Cols?
fields.description: Whether to replace existing columns or create new ones?

fields.description: Input columns for encoding

fields.name: outputCols

fields.description: Output columns

fields.name: stringOrderType

fields.description: Param for how to order labels of string column

nodes.name: Vector Assembler
nodes.description: Merges multiple columns into a vector column.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: inputCols
fields.title: Input Columns
fields.description: Input column of type - all numeric, boolean and vector

fields.name: outputCol
fields.title: Output Column
fields.description: Output column name

fields.name: handleInvalid
fields.title: Handle Invalid
fields.description: How to handle invalid data (NULL values). Options are 'skip' (filter out rows with invalid data), 'error' (throw an error), or 'keep' (return relevant number of NaN in the output).

nodes.name: Random Forest Classifier
nodes.description: Supports both binary and multiclass labels, as well as both continuous and categorical features.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: featuresCol
fields.title: Features Column
fields.description: Features column of type vectorUDT for model fitting

fields.name: labelCol
fields.title: Label Column
fields.description: The label column for model fitting

fields.name: predictionCol
fields.title: Prediction Column
fields.description: The prediction column created during model scoring.

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Save Confusion Matrix to Path

fields.name: featureSubsetStrategy
fields.title: Feature Subset Strategy
fields.description: The number of features to consider for splits at each tree node.

fields.name: impurity
fields.title: Impurity
fields.description: The Criterion used for information gain calculation

fields.name: maxBins
fields.title: Max Bins
fields.description: The maximum number of bins used for discretizing continuous features.Must be >= 2 and >= number of categories in any categorical feature.

fields.name: maxDepth
fields.title: Max Depth
fields.description: The Maximum depth of a tree

fields.name: minInfoGain
fields.title: Min Information Gain
fields.description: The Minimum information gain for a split to be considered at a tree node

fields.name: minInstancesPerNode
fields.title: Min Instances Per Node
fields.description: The Minimum number of instances each child must have after split

fields.name: numTrees
fields.title: Num Trees
fields.description: The number of trees to train

fields.name: subsamplingRate
fields.title: Subsampling Rate
fields.description: The fraction of the training data used for learning each decision tree.

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: The random seed

fields.name: cacheNodeIds
fields.title: Cache Node Ids
fields.description: The caching nodes IDs. Can speed up training of deeper trees.

fields.name: checkpointInterval
fields.title: Checkpoint Interval
fields.description: The checkpoint interval. E.g. 10 means that the cache will get checkpointed every 10 iterations.Set checkpoint interval (>= 1) or disable checkpoint (-1)

fields.name: maxMemoryInMB
fields.title: Max memory
fields.description: Maximum memory in MB allocated to histogram aggregation.

fields.name: minWeightFractionPerNode
fields.title: Min weight fraction per node
fields.description: Minimum fraction of the weighted sample count that each child must have after split

fields.name: bootstrap
fields.title: Bootstrap
fields.description: Whether bootstrap samples are used when building trees.

fields.name: weightCol
fields.title: Weight Column
fields.description: Param for weight column name. If this is not set or empty, we treat all instance weights as 1.0.

fields.name: minInfoGainGrid
fields.title: Min Information Gain Param Grid Search
fields.description: Min Information Gain Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: maxBinsGrid
fields.title: Max Bins Param Grid Search
fields.description: Max Bins Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: maxDepthGrid
fields.title: Max Depth Param Grid Search
fields.description: Max Depth Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: numTreesGrid
fields.title: Number trees Param Grid Search
fields.description: Total number of trees Parameters for Grid Search

nodes.name: Row Filter
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame containing the rows that satisfy the given condition

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: conditionExpr
fields.value:
(('%' IN (${arg_gender1})) OR (GENDER IN (${arg_gender1})) AND
('%' IN (${arg_selectCategory1})) OR (CATEGORY IN (${arg_selectCategory1})))
fields.title: Conditional Expression
fields.description: The filtering condition. Rows not satisfying given condition will be excluded from output DataFrame. eg: usd_pledged_real > 0 and (category = 1 or category == 2) and goal > 100

nodes.name: Spark ML Model Save
nodes.description: This node saves the ML model generated at the specified path.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: fixedPath
fields.title: Static path
fields.description: Set this to true if you want model to be saved in a static path. It will overwrite the model in the directory specified.
